events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car hitting a guardrail on the highway, resulting in moderate damage to the front bumper.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under 'Auto Accident' due to vehicle damage and collision details provided by the claimant.
A claims agent was assigned promptly to handle the case and begin the investigation to assist the customer with their accident claim.
Acknowledgement of the claim was sent to the customer, confirming receipt and assuring them that the process has begun.
The agent requested photos of the damaged vehicle, a copy of the police report, and the driver’s license for verification purposes.
The insured submitted all requested documents including images of the vehicle damage and the official police report from the accident.
The claims investigation team began reviewing submitted evidence to confirm circumstances and liability related to the auto accident.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the insured was not at fault and the vehicle damage corresponded with the reported collision.
A settlement amount was proposed based on repair estimates and policy coverage limits, communicated to the customer for their approval.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and the efficient handling of their auto accident claim.
Final approval of the claim was granted and preparation for issuing payment to cover the vehicle repair costs was initiated.
The insurer processed and issued the settlement payment to the insured’s account to cover the agreed repair expenses.
The claim was officially closed following confirmation of payment receipt and customer satisfaction with the resolution.
